channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump's threat of tariffs reaches global leaders in Davos
item.description: President Trump addressed the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, and reiterated his quest to obtain tariffs from companies importing their go...

item.title: President Trump's suspension of asylum marks a break from U.S. past
item.description: Lee Gelernt with the ACLU said the action goes "way beyond anything that even President Trump has tried in the past."

item.title: What to know about President Donald Trump’s order targeting the rights of transgender people
Trump taps conservative media critic to lead global news agency
item.description: President Trump plans to nominate a conservative critic of the mainstream media, L. Brent Bozell III, to run the U.S. Agency for Global Media, which o...

item.title: Firefighters battle huge blaze near Los Angeles as winds pick up
item.description: Authorities warn Thursday is "the period of greatest concern" as conditions remain extremely dry.

item.title: Russian ships return to Syrian base ahead of expected withdrawal
item.description: Analysts say the return suggests that Moscow is preparing to evacuate one of its most valuable overseas bases.

item.title: Trump's entry into crypto opens new doors for those seeking political influence
item.description: Bloomberg investigative reporter Zeke Faux says the Trump family crypto business offers anyone seeking favor with the new administration a legal way t...

item.title: Sacklers, Purdue Pharma reach $7.4B settlement with 15 states over opioid crisis
item.description: The Sackler family will pay the vast majority of the settlement — a total of $6.5 billion over 15 years.

item.title: Teen who killed 3 girls at Taylor Swift-themed dance class sentenced
item.description: Axel Rudakubana, who killed three girls at a dance class, will likely "never be released" from prison, a judge said Thursday.

item.title: 'My daughter's bones were scattered on the ground' - the harrowing search for the missing of Gaza
item.description: Palestinian health authorities estimate 10,000 people are likely to be dead beneath Gaza's ruins.

item.title: Trump threatens to withhold wildfire aid ahead of Los Angeles visit
item.description: President Trump is set to make his first trip as president to visit areas devastated by the Los Angeles wildfires.

item.title: French divorcee wins appeal in case over refusing husband sex
item.description: Europe's highest human rights court ruled the refusal of sex is not a valid ground for fault in a divorce.

item.title: With Trump pivot back to pro-oil and gas policies, one renewable energy finds favor

item.description: After the ouster of Syria's longtime leader Bashar al-Assad last month, Israel's military has taken up a new post in the demilitarized buffer zone cre...

item.description: New Los Angeles wildfire prompts more evacuations, nominees for the 97th Academy Awards were announced and American farmers are bracing for changes un...

item.title: On Dakota prairie, home of Trump’s DHS pick, immigration crackdown threatens way of life, economy
item.description: Gov. Kristi Noem’s heated rhetoric on immigration belies a stark economic reality in her own state: With unemployment at 1.9% — the lowest in the coun...

item.title: ICC prosecutor seeks arrest of Taliban leaders for 'persecuting Afghan girls and women'
item.description: Karim Khan is seeking arrest warrants for the Taliban government's Supreme Leader and chief justice.
